column1: My penis is only four inches but some girls like it that wide.
column3: The word wide can refer to physical dimensions and also means extensive or significant in scope.
column4: The road is wide enough for two cars to pass easily.
column5: The wide-ranging effects of the policy were felt throughout the community.

column1: Im selling a used french rifle never been fired, only dropped once.
column3: The word fired refers to the act of discharging a weapon and also means being terminated from employment.
column4: The soldier fired his weapon during the training exercise.
column5: After being fired from his job, he decided to start his own business.

column1: What do you call an incredibly well-dressed punk? the speaker of the house
column3: The word speaker refers to someone who speaks or gives speeches, and its also used to denote a leader of a legislative assembly.
column4: The speaker delivered a compelling speech during the conference.
column5: The speaker of the house announced new legislation to the press.

column1: If youre married to your dick... would you be a wife beater?
column3: The word beat can mean to hit someone violently, and also means to defeat someone in competition.
column4: The child was beaten for misbehaving in school.
column5: Our team managed to beat the reigning champions in the finals.

column1: Whats the difference between a snowman and snow woman? snowballs
column3: The word balls can refer to spheres used in games and also has a slang meaning for male anatomy.
column4: The children played with various balls in the park.
column5: He felt very embarrassed when someone mentioned the size of his balls.

column1: You dont love dunkin donuts coffee, you love heavy cream.
column3: The word heavy can refer to something that has a lot of weight and also signifies something significant or intense.
column4: The heavy box was difficult to lift without assistance.
column5: The issue requires heavy consideration before making a decision.
